title: The Pink Panther Classic Cartoon Collection
description:
Info:
The Pink Panther is paws down the world&#039;s grooviest cartoon star. In 1964 this pink-inked feline slinked onto the opening credits of Blake Edwards&#039; caper film by the same name and threatened to steal the entire show. Sleek sophisticated and witty the animation produced by Friz Freleng and David H. DePatie was a stylish departure from its contemporaries and an instant hit. A subsequent short film The Pink Phink would go on to win* an OscarÃƒâ€šÃ‚Â® and spawn a celebrated series of six-minute cartoons featuring the sly cat. Now for the first time 124 cartoons produced by Freleng and DePatie between 1964 and 1980 are collected here in a swingin&#039; 5-disc set. With over 14 hours of "pink comedy" you can&#039;t help but lick your whiskers!

Release date on DVD:
January 31, 2006

Source:
R1 NTSC DVD

Video:
Full Frame 1.33:1

Audio:
Dolby Digital Mono

Subtitles:
French, Portuguese, Spanish

Runtime:
13 hours 17 minutes (5 discs)

DVD features:
- "Behind the Feline: The Cartoon Phenomenon" Documentary
- "Pink Patter With Art Leonardi: The Story Behind the Animation" Featurette
- "Remembering Friz: A Tribute to Friz Freleng" Featurette
- "Think Pink: How to Draw the Pink Panther" Featurette
- Page to Screen: The Making of Two Cartoons
- Animated Main Title Sequences From Five of the Feature Films
